choices.C: The command config system global does not exist in FortiGate.
choices.D: The global settings cannot be configured from the root VDOM context.
choices.B: The administrator admin does not have the privileges required to configure global settings.
choices.A: The administrator must first enter the command edit global.

choices.B: Only digital certificates will be accepted as an authentication method in phase 1.
choices.D: Dialup clients must provide a username and password for authentication.
choices.A: Dialup clients must provide their local ID during phase 2 negotiations.
choices.C: Phase 1 negotiations will skip preshared key exchange.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has configured a dialup IPsec VPN with XAuth.
Which statement best describes what occurs during this scenario?

discussion.content:
Answer is D,,,
if the Backup is required in this case,,,,will be Partial mesh
La respuesta correcta es la D porque deben conectarse con 2 HQ
Partial Mesh is the corect answer

questions.question_text:
Consider a new IPsec deployment with the following criteria:
✑ All satellite offices must connect to the two HQ sites.
✑ The satellite offices do not need to communicate directly with other satellite offices.
✑ Backup VPN is not required.
✑ The design should minimize the number of tunnels being configured.
Which topology should you use to satisfy all of the requirements?

discussion.content: Polly is correct- FGT_Infrastructure-6.2, p. 293 the diagram shows the Election order :Override Enabled.
Answer A is the right answer: https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/handbook/666653

comments.content: D is the correct answer this is the correct link:https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/handbook/666653
When override is enabled it's D, When override is disabled it's A therefore correct answer is D

questions.question_text: When override is enabled, which option shows the process and selection criteria that is used to elect the primary FortiGate in an HA cluster?

choices.A: Connected monitored ports > HA uptime > priority > serial number
choices.B: HA uptime > priority > Connected monitored ports > serial number
choices.D: Connected monitored ports > priority > HA uptime > serial number
choices.C: Priority > Connected monitored ports > HA uptime > serial number

choices.D: Use a web browser that does not support HPKP.
choices.A: Enable Allow Invalid SSL Certificates for the relevant security profile.
choices.C: Install the CA certificate (that is required to verify the web server certificate) in the certificate stores of users' computers.
choices.B: Exempt those web sites that use HPKP from full SSL inspection.

discussion.content: B & D are correct - FGT_Security-6.2, p. 339

questions.question_text:
HTTP public key pinning (HPKP) can be an obstacle to implementing full SSL inspection.
In which two ways can you resolve this problem? (Choose two.)
